intro: Oxytropis siomensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, spindly growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis siomensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
